subject: Home & DIY
title: Off-Gassing: When New Things Smell Toxic
description: One-minute skill: Off-Gassing: When New Things Smell Toxic.

hook.text: That 'new carpet smell' is volatile organic compounds evaporating into your air. It's not freshnessâ€”it's chemicals.

buildup.text: VOCs include formaldehyde, benzene, and toluene. They off-gas from paints, adhesives, foam, plywood, and fabrics.

discovery.text: Indoor air can be 2-5x more polluted than outdoor air. New construction and renovations spike VOC levels fast.

twist.text: Most off-gassing happens in the first 72 hours. Opening windows for three days after new materials slashes exposure.

climax.text: Low-VOC and zero-VOC paints, adhesives, and flooring now exist. Labels like GREENGUARD verify the claim.

punchline.text: If your new room smells fresh, ventilate it fast.

quiz.question: When does most off-gassing from new materials occur?
options: Within the first 72 hours after installation
Gradually over the first five years
Only when exposed to direct sunlight
